definition: to follow bad examples/to be corrupted by bad examples
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: Never understand Mei often night he worries that its bad-men go to, and advice, to provoke mei dissatisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 梅常夜歸，玥擔心其學壞而勸告，惹梅不滿。

sentences.english: You cannot open a book without learning something.
sentences.chinese: 學好千日不足，學壞一時有餘。

sentences.english: Emboli in the Zhao Fu soon learn bad, mercenary and sensual.
sentences.chinese: 栓子在趙府很快學壞，貪財好色。

sentences.english: These films are likely to deprave the children.
sentences.chinese: 那些影片會使孩子們學壞。

sentences.english: It's just that, in the past, they have lacked confidence or opportunity to stray.
sentences.chinese: 只是在過去，她們缺少“學壞”的信心或者機會。

sentences.english: I am a great friend to public amusements; for they keep people from vice.
sentences.chinese: 我非常支持公共娛樂活動，它會防止人們學壞。

sentences.english: Those who eat best and drink best often do worst.
sentences.chinese: 只圖喫好穿好，學壞常常免不了。

sentences.english: They will learn to be bad, more people also want to follow bad.
sentences.chinese: 他們學壞了，還想讓更多的人也跟着學壞。

sentences.english: They will learn to be bad, more people also want to follow bad.
sentences.chinese: 他們學壞了，還想讓更多的人也跟着學壞。

definition: to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to be made to stand still as a punishment
angry words/sth said in the moment of anger
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
